Thu, 28 Dec 2023 19:25:43 +0000 In 2022, Hato Hone St John responded to 434 water incidents throughout New Zealand — a 14 per cent increase on the previous year. Photo / RNZ, Surf Life Saving NZ
Revealed: Ever-vanishing take-up of tertiary fees-free among those from poorer backgrounds https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/revealed-ever-vanishing-take-up-of-tertiary-fees-free-among-those-from-poorer-backgrounds/5EHBSS4MC5BLTNEDYTNBXAG4KE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/revealed-ever-vanishing-take-up-of-tertiary-fees-free-among-those-from-poorer-backgrounds/5EHBSS4MC5BLTNEDYTNBXAG4KE/ Derek ChengThose from decile 1 schools make up an ever-shrinking share of fees-free students. Thu, 28 Dec 2023 18:40:04 +0000 Fees-free was introduced in 2018 to increase participation and open the door to those who faced financial barriers, but it has increased inequity and numbers are falling.
Major shift revealed: Police charging half the drug users they used to, though numbers creeping up again https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/major-shift-revealed-police-charging-half-the-drug-users-they-used-to-though-numbers-creeping-up-again/ M6AOVZ5K25C47FT44MRGPWDVKM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/major-shift-revealed-police-charging-half-the-drug-users-they-used-to-though-numbers-creeping-up-again/ M6AOVZ5K25C47FT44MRGPWDVKM/ Derek ChengThe law change was hailed as effective decriminalisation of drug use. Has that happened? Thu, 28 Dec 2023 18:23:07 +0000 Drug users were being charged less and less by police since a 2019 law change, but the pendulum has swung back towards the punitive since November 2021. Photo / Hayden Woodward
